page.title: 17DINSDALE FARMS
page.content:
Rose Hill Farm of approximately 136 acres. the farm has one house occupied by the farmer. Main crops: Barley 30 acres. The rest of the land is used for grazing cattle and conservation for winter feed. The river Tees runs through this farm, and the fishing rights are owned by the owner of the Dinsdale Estate, which is at present being broken up.
Manor Farm, Low Dinsdale 284 acres.Farmed by one family with one famhouse on the land. Main crops: Barley 80 acres Wheat 120 acres Potatoes 20 acres Peas 25 acres Grass 39 acres 200 sheep are also run on this farm and 16000 chickens are also kept.
